alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 7:27PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado in Douglas County. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 2 and 2.7 inches of rain have fallen. The rain has moved south out of the area but expect minor flooding issues for another hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenland and the El Dorado Acres neighborhood.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
